title: Female Judges in Afghanistan, Now Jobless and in Hiding
content: They fear that they or their loved ones could be tracked down and killed because of their work delivering justice to women. “We have lost everything — our jobs, our homes, the way we lived.”
en_title: Female Judges in Afghanistan, Now Jobless and in Hiding
en_content: They fear that they or their loved ones could be tracked down and killed because of their work delivering justice to women. “We have lost everything — our jobs, our homes, the way we lived.”

title: Brazilian Leader Accused of Crimes Against Humanity in Pandemic Response
content: A report from lawmakers initially said Jair Bolsonaro should be charged with mass homicide and genocide, accusing him of letting Covid-19 spread in a failed bid for herd immunity.
en_title: Brazilian Leader Accused of Crimes Against Humanity in Pandemic Response
en_content: A report from lawmakers initially said Jair Bolsonaro should be charged with mass homicide and genocide, accusing him of letting Covid-19 spread in a failed bid for herd immunity.

title: Kidnappers in Haiti Demand $17 Million to Free Missionary Group
content: A gang abducted 17 people associated with a Christian aid group, including five children. Most of those being held are Americans; one is Canadian.

more_info.byline: By Andre Paultre, Constant Méheut and Maria Abi-Habib

en_title: Kidnappers in Haiti Demand $17 Million to Free Missionary Group
en_content: A gang abducted 17 people associated with a Christian aid group, including five children. Most of those being held are Americans; one is Canadian.

title: Thousands Flee Myanmar for India Amid Fears of a Growing Refugee Crisis
content: For decades, armed conflict, political repression and targeted campaigns against minorities have forced hundreds of thousands of people to leave the country. Now many more are expected to follow.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

en_title: Thousands Flee Myanmar for India Amid Fears of a Growing Refugee Crisis
en_content: For decades, armed conflict, political repression and targeted campaigns against minorities have forced hundreds of thousands of people to leave the country. Now many more are expected to follow.

title: They Fought Apartheid in South Africa. Now They Want Veterans’ Benefits.
content: A protest movement by those who took up arms against apartheid has grown confrontational. More than 50 of them have been charged with kidnapping the country’s defense minister.
en_title: They Fought Apartheid in South Africa. Now They Want Veterans’ Benefits.
en_content: A protest movement by those who took up arms against apartheid has grown confrontational. More than 50 of them have been charged with kidnapping the country’s defense minister.

title: These U.S. Veterans Won’t Rest Until They’ve Kept a Wartime Promise
content: An informal network that includes former government and military officials is working around the clock to fulfill a pledge to save Afghans who put their lives on the line for America.

des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

en_title: These U.S. Veterans Won’t Rest Until They’ve Kept a Wartime Promise
en_content: An informal network that includes former government and military officials is working around the clock to fulfill a pledge to save Afghans who put their lives on the line for America.

title: F.B.I. Raids Homes Linked to Russian Oligarch
content: Agents investigating whether Oleg Deripaska violated U.S. sanctions searched homes he has used in New York and Washington, D.C.

more_info.byline: By William K. Rashbaum and Kenneth P. Vogel
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

en_title: F.B.I. Raids Homes Linked to Russian Oligarch
en_content: Agents investigating whether Oleg Deripaska violated U.S. sanctions searched homes he has used in New York and Washington, D.C.

title: Taliban Allow Polio Vaccine Program to Restart in Afghanistan
content: Taliban leaders also agreed to allow women to be frontline workers for the effort, according to the World Health Organization and UNICEF.
en_title: Taliban Allow Polio Vaccine Program to Restart in Afghanistan
en_content: Taliban leaders also agreed to allow women to be frontline workers for the effort, according to the World Health Organization and UNICEF.

title: Britain Outlines Energy Plans Amid Dimming Prospects for Climate Summit
content: In an effort to recapture momentum, Prime Minister Boris Johnson  announced a host of measures, including plans for a big expansion of electric vehicles, more offshore wind power and greater use of hydrogen.

more_info.byline: By Stephen Castle and Mark Landler

en_title: Britain Outlines Energy Plans Amid Dimming Prospects for Climate Summit
en_content: In an effort to recapture momentum, Prime Minister Boris Johnson  announced a host of measures, including plans for a big expansion of electric vehicles, more offshore wind power and greater use of hydrogen.

title: Bombing of Military Bus in Syrian Capital Kills 14
content: President Bashar al-Assad has tightened his grip on Damascus, but the attack suggested that militants who oppose him can still do harm.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

en_title: Bombing of Military Bus in Syrian Capital Kills 14
en_content: President Bashar al-Assad has tightened his grip on Damascus, but the attack suggested that militants who oppose him can still do harm.

title: Transgender Woman Flees Malaysia After Prison Threat for Wearing Hijab
content: The Islamic authorities want to imprison her for wearing female clothing at a religious event and threatened to put her in a rehabilitation camp where she could “return to the right path.”

more_info.byline: By Hannah Beech and Hadi Azmi

en_title: Transgender Woman Flees Malaysia After Prison Threat for Wearing Hijab
en_content: The Islamic authorities want to imprison her for wearing female clothing at a religious event and threatened to put her in a rehabilitation camp where she could “return to the right path.”

title: New York City will require all city employees to be vaccinated.
content: The mandate will remove an option to take regular tests instead of getting a shot.
en_title: New York City will require all city employees to be vaccinated.
en_content: The mandate will remove an option to take regular tests instead of getting a shot.

title: Queen ‘Reluctantly’ Cancels Trip, Citing Medical Advice
content: Britain’s 95-year-old monarch will not travel to Northern Ireland but is “in good spirits,” Buckingham Palace said.

per_facet: Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

en_title: Queen ‘Reluctantly’ Cancels Trip, Citing Medical Advice
en_content: Britain’s 95-year-old monarch will not travel to Northern Ireland but is “in good spirits,” Buckingham Palace said.

content: How can so many Americans afford not to work? And will it last?

en_content: How can so many Americans afford not to work? And will it last?

title: The Olympic torch arrives in Beijing under a cloud of protests and Covid fears.
content: A subdued ceremony in Beijing on Wednesday sets the tone for the Winter Olympics of 2022, which will be held under extraordinary health protocols.
en_title: The Olympic torch arrives in Beijing under a cloud of protests and Covid fears.
en_content: A subdued ceremony in Beijing on Wednesday sets the tone for the Winter Olympics of 2022, which will be held under extraordinary health protocols.

title: Writing About a Past Injustice Helped Her See What Has and Hasn’t Changed
content: Nadifa Mohamed is a Booker Prize finalist for her novel “The Fortune Men,” a story about a false accusation and the tragedy that resulted.
en_title: Writing About a Past Injustice Helped Her See What Has and Hasn’t Changed
en_content: Nadifa Mohamed is a Booker Prize finalist for her novel “The Fortune Men,” a story about a false accusation and the tragedy that resulted.

title: 1971: Paris Installs Giant Air Filters to Combat Pollution
content: Two towers, each measuring 16 and a half feet high, were installed in an area in the east of the city in an experiment to tackle contamination.
en_title: 1971: Paris Installs Giant Air Filters to Combat Pollution
en_content: Two towers, each measuring 16 and a half feet high, were installed in an area in the east of the city in an experiment to tackle contamination.

content: The popular burger chain said it refused to become “the vaccination police for any government.”

content: The broadcaster has survived cancer and open-heart surgery and has multiple sclerosis.

title: U.S.-Venezuela Tensions Heat Up Again After Extradition of Maduro Ally
content: As Secretary of State Antony Blinken heads to the region, the window of opportunity for a political resolution has slammed shut. At least for now.

title: Attendance falls for homeless students in N.Y.C., in part because of the pandemic, a study shows.
content: Attendance rates for students living in shelters fell to just 73 percent in the first few weeks of the new school year, compared with around 90 percent for all students.
en_title: Attendance falls for homeless students in N.Y.C., in part because of the pandemic, a study shows.
en_content: Attendance rates for students living in shelters fell to just 73 percent in the first few weeks of the new school year, compared with around 90 percent for all students.

title: Covid deaths soar in Ukraine as the country struggles with fake vaccine certificates.
content: In the country with the lowest rate of coronavirus vaccination in Europe, the proliferation of fakes threatens to undermine Ukraine’s fight against the virus.
en_title: Covid deaths soar in Ukraine as the country struggles with fake vaccine certificates.
en_content: In the country with the lowest rate of coronavirus vaccination in Europe, the proliferation of fakes threatens to undermine Ukraine’s fight against the virus.

title: A Warning That Africa’s Last Glaciers Will Soon Vanish
content: While African nations contribute less than 4 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions, a U.N. report underscored the outsize impact that climate change is having on the continent.
en_title: A Warning That Africa’s Last Glaciers Will Soon Vanish
en_content: While African nations contribute less than 4 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions, a U.N. report underscored the outsize impact that climate change is having on the continent.

content: The F.D.A. may authorize booster shots of vaccines different from the ones that Americans originally received. The science behind the move is promising.

en_content: The F.D.A. may authorize booster shots of vaccines different from the ones that Americans originally received. The science behind the move is promising.

content: Admiral Rachel Levine is the first female four-star admiral in the history of the he U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps, which she already leads in her role as assistant secretary.

title: Unvaccinated public employees in Washington and Massachusetts now risk suspension or firing.

title: On a Pacific Island, Russia Tests Its Battle Plan for Climate Change
content: President Vladimir V. Putin long dismissed the threat posed by global warming. But fires, disasters and foreign pressure have prompted him to change course.
